The conscience, a persisting notion. From a prolonged form of suneido; co-perception, i.e. Moral consciousness.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

22.str2: Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.

23.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
23.str2: From kata and echo; to hold down, in various applications.
Unbent, unyielding, resolute, firm. Not leaning, i.e. firm.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.
A profession, confession. From the same as homologeo; acknowledgment.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

23.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
23.str2: From epi and the base of aggelos; to announce upon, i.e. to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself.

24.str2: To take note of, perceive, consider carefully, discern, detect, make account of. From kata and noieo; to observe fully.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Stimulation, provocation, irritation, angry dispute. From paroxuno; incitement, or dispute.

24.str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

25.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
25.str2: From en and kataleipo; to leave behind in some place, i.e. let remain over, or to desert.

25.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

25.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
25.str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.

25.str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

25.str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

25.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
25.str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.

26.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Willingly, of one's own accord, spontaneously. Adverb from the same as hekousion; voluntarily.

26.str2: Perhaps from a and the base of meros; properly, to miss the mark, i.e. to err, especially to sin.

(a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.

26.str2: From apo and leipo; to leave behind; by implication, to forsake.

Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.

28.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

28.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
28.str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.

Pity, compassion, favor, grace, mercy. From oikteiro; pity.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Three. Or neuter tria a primary number; 'three'.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.

29.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Dative Neuter Singular
29.str2: How much, how great, how many. From an absolute pos and hos; interrogative pronoun how much (plural) many).
